description:
Kyverno is a Kubernetes-native policy engine that allows users to create, validate, and enforce policies for Kubernetes configurations. It enables automated policy management, including resource validation, mutation, and cleanup, to ensure compliance and best practices in Kubernetes clusters. This dashboard provides visibility into Kyverno's performance and operations, offering insights into policy execution, requeuing, dropping of elements, and overall controller health, helping administrators monitor and optimize policy enforcement.

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog Kyverno Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/kyverno/)
- [Kyverno Docs](https://main.kyverno.io/docs/introduction/)
- [Kyverno Monitoring Docs](https://main.kyverno.io/docs/monitoring/)
title: Kyverno Overview

definition.content: Kyverno is a Kubernetes-native policy engine that allows users to create, validate, and enforce policies for Kubernetes configurations. It enables automated policy management, including resource validation, mutation, and cleanup, to ensure compliance and best practices in Kubernetes clusters. This dashboard provides visibility into Kyverno's performance and operations, offering insights into policy execution, requeuing, dropping of elements, and overall controller health, helping administrators monitor and optimize policy enforcement.
Kyverno Overview show a quick summary of all reporting Kyverno instances and related monitors and their status.

queries.name: query1
queries.query: count:kubernetes.containers.running{(short_image:kyverno OR short_image:cleanup-controller OR short_image:background-controller OR short_image:reports-controller) AND $kube_cluster_name AND $kube_app_component} by {short_image}

definition.content: Policy metrics are crucial for monitoring Kyverno's performance, showing the number of active policies, application results, application counts, and latency, to ensure efficient and compliant cluster management.

These metrics track the number of times a controller requeues or drops elements. Requeuing indicates retry attempts after encountering an error, while dropping reflects unrecoverable errors where the controller has failed to process an item after several retries.
This set of metrics shows the overall workload and any potential errors detected while the controllers perform their core tasks.
Kyverno logs can provide insights into the performance of Kyverno instances, aiding in diagnosing issues and ensuring effective policy enforcement. Grouped by patterns for better overview

query.query_string: source:(kyverno OR cleanup-controller OR reports-controller OR backup-controller) $kube_cluster_name $kube_app_component

definition.content: Runtime metrics provide insight into each components core resource usage. This can help identify bottlenecks in resource allocations or insufficientcies.
